title: The names of authors of primary works have been standardised for consistency in both the endnotes and the bibliography. 1 Angels fascinated both medieval scholars and lay people. Good angels acted as individual guardians, God’s messengers and servants. Evil angels tempted humans, contributing to their fall. placed angels within Genesis’ creation account. Peter Lombard’s influence was crucial – his exhaustive treatment in the Sententiae, coupled with their integration within the Sententiae’s other main topics, ensured angelology was put firmly on the agenda
